title: Lock contention discovered in large put request scenario
body:
In our recent etcd performance analysis, we found that wait.go can have lock contentions during large put requests.

https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/blob/master/pkg/wait/wait.go

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3913185/109362869-c13a5e00-7840-11eb-9015-a813c929e2ca.png)

I added a patch which uses an array of lists in Wait struct and use mod to calculate which one to use using mod operation. I can see instant put performance improvements.

Before:
Summary:
  Total:        64.4823 secs.
  Slowest:      0.0799 secs.
  Fastest:      0.0002 secs.
  Average:      0.0021 secs.
  Stddev:       0.0051 secs.
  Requests/sec: 31016.2797


After:
Summary:
  Total:        58.2040 secs.
  Slowest:      0.0785 secs.
  Fastest:      0.0002 secs.
  Average:      0.0019 secs.
  Stddev:       0.0052 secs.
  Requests/sec: 34361.9063


benchmark command:
`
GOMAXPROCS=6 ./tools/benchmark/benchmark put --conns=64 --clients=64 --key-size=256 --val-size=4096 --key-space-size=50000 --total=2000000 --endpoints "http://127.0.0.1:23790" 2> /dev/null;
`

etcd single server command:
`
GOMAXPROCS=10 ./bin/etcd --quota-backend-bytes=17179869184 --listen-client-urls http://0.0.0.0:23790 --advertise-client-urls http://127.0.0.1:23790 --log-level error
`

I can submit a pull request for this change. This is not a big change. I am posing an issue here is just I want to have a throughout discussion before sending a pull request.
